description: From brachy- +‎ -logy, from Ancient Greek βραχυλογία (brakhulogía), from βραχύς (brakhús, “short”) + λογία (logía, “speech”); compare brachyology.

entries.meaning: (rhetoric) Any of several forms of omission of words, including the omission of an understood part of a phrase, as, the omission of "good" from "(good) morning!"
